Class AbstractCacheInvoker

java.lang.Object
org.springframework.cache.interceptor.AbstractCacheInvoker
Direct Known Subclasses:
CacheAspectSupport, JCacheAspectSupport
public abstract class AbstractCacheInvoker extends Object
A base component for invoking Cache operations and using a configurable CacheErrorHandler when an exception occurs.
Since:
4.1
Author:
Stephane Nicoll, Juergen Hoeller, Simon Basl√©
See Also:

  • Field Details

    • errorHandler

      protected SingletonSupplier<CacheErrorHandler> errorHandler

  • Constructor Details

    • AbstractCacheInvoker

      protected AbstractCacheInvoker()

    • AbstractCacheInvoker

      protected AbstractCacheInvoker(CacheErrorHandler errorHandler)

  • Method Details

    • setErrorHandler

      public void setErrorHandler(CacheErrorHandler errorHandler)
      Set the CacheErrorHandler instance to use to handle errors thrown by the cache provider. By default, a SimpleCacheErrorHandler is used who throws any exception as is.

    • getErrorHandler

      public CacheErrorHandler getErrorHandler()
      Return the CacheErrorHandler to use.

    • doGet

      protected @Nullable Cache.ValueWrapper doGet(Cache cache, Object key)
      Execute Cache.get(Object) on the specified Cache and invoke the error handler if an exception occurs. Return null if the handler does not throw any exception, which simulates a cache miss in case of error.
      See Also:
      • Cache.get(Object)

    • doGet

      protected <T> @Nullable T doGet(Cache cache, Object key, Callable<T> valueLoader)
      Execute Cache.get(Object, Callable) on the specified Cache and invoke the error handler if an exception occurs. Invokes the valueLoader if the handler does not throw any exception, which simulates a cache read-through in case of error.
      Since:
      6.2
      See Also:
      • Cache.get(Object, Callable)

    • doRetrieve

      protected @Nullable CompletableFuture<?> doRetrieve(Cache cache, Object key)
      Execute Cache.retrieve(Object) on the specified Cache and invoke the error handler if an exception occurs. Returns null if the handler does not throw any exception, which simulates a cache miss in case of error.
      Since:
      6.2
      See Also:
      • Cache.retrieve(Object)

    • doRetrieve

      protected <T> CompletableFuture<T> doRetrieve(Cache cache, Object key, Supplier<CompletableFuture<T>> valueLoader)
      Execute Cache.retrieve(Object, Supplier) on the specified Cache and invoke the error handler if an exception occurs. Invokes the valueLoader if the handler does not throw any exception, which simulates a cache read-through in case of error.
      Since:
      6.2
      See Also:
      • Cache.retrieve(Object, Supplier)

    • doPut

      protected void doPut(Cache cache, Object key, @Nullable Object value)
      Execute Cache.put(Object, Object) on the specified Cache and invoke the error handler if an exception occurs.

    • doEvict

      protected void doEvict(Cache cache, Object key, boolean immediate)
      Execute Cache.evict(Object)/Cache.evictIfPresent(Object) on the specified Cache and invoke the error handler if an exception occurs.

    • doClear

      protected void doClear(Cache cache, boolean immediate)
      Execute Cache.clear() on the specified Cache and invoke the error handler if an exception occurs.
